sys_metadata_link.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="x_snc_cfe_confcoor_table"> <x_snc_cfe_confcoor_table action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <a_act_foreign_nationals>0</a_act_foreign_nationals> <a_act_gov_nongov>0</a_act_gov_nongov> <a_act_ic_employees>0</a_act_ic_employees> <a_act_ind_ffrdc>0</a_act_ind_ffrdc> <a_act_total>0</a_act_total> <a_comments>Message from the COO: Excelling Through Teamwork  Published: 27 April 2020   (S//NF) To all the members of our Blue Team, welcome back to work. Wherever you're serving, whether it's in the field or here at Headquarters, we're grateful for your dedication to mission.  (S//NF) To all the members of our Blue Team, welcome back to work. Wherever you're serving, whether it's in the field or here at Headquarters, we're grateful for your dedication to mission. Throughout this crisis, individuals across the Agency have stepped up to serve in remarkable ways. But it's our collective action that has impressed me the most. All of you, in your own way, have displayed a profound commitment to helping one another and to moving us forward as a team.   (S//NF) Despite the distances between us, we're innovating together, confronting challenges together, and persevering together. That needs to continue. More than anything, the key to getting though this crisis is teamwork, so in the week ahead, I hope you'll keep reaching out to your colleagues and supporting each other.  (S//NF) Last week, Deputy Director Bishop shared in a note that Agency leadership is actively working on a reconstitution plan, and in the coming weeks it will be ready to share. Our primary focus in these planning efforts will continue to be protecting the health and wellbeing of our workforce and broader Agency family while continuing to meet our mission. Having thoughtfully considered regional data, we are beginning to plan for gradually increasing staffing in the WMA beginning in mid-to-late May by moving some personnel each week from reserve to active status. We will continue the Blue/Gold Team rotation into the month of June. In the coming weeks, you will receive individualized guidance from your management. Our reconstitution plan will be guided by the latest regional data on the virus, so please continue to be flexible.  (U//FOUO) As we look at getting the Agency back to full strength, we'll continue updating policies to maximize our ability to carry out mission while safeguarding our people. To that end, last week, we established two new policies that will help us fight the spread of the virus more effectively. First, all Agency personnel are now required to swipe their badges every time they enter a new vault. This will help with contact tracing when we identify individuals who catch the virus or who develop symptoms associated with COVID-19.  (U//FOUO) Second, we're asking everyone to keep a Weekly Log of contacts any time you are less than six feet for more than ten minutes. You can find more details on both measures in the workforce message that I sent out on Wednesday.</a_comments> <a_est_foreign_nationals>365</a_est_foreign_nationals> Upload your cost comparison files along with your conference request. Using a competitively awarded conference planning/support contract meets the tree commercial site cost comparison analysis requirement.
